caption.p: Growth kinetics of reassortant avian influenza virus (AIVs) in cells. (A) DF-1 or (B) Madinâ€“Darby canine kidney (MDCK) cells were infected with one of four reassortant viruses at a 0.01 multiplicity of infection (MOI), and the yield of viral progeny was determined at 12, 24, 36, and 48 h post infection (hpi) by standard plaque assay [plaque-forming units (PFUs)/ml). The mean yields and standard error of triplicate experiments are displayed. *Indicates a significant difference ( p < 0.05) between yield of the progeny and parental virus (NS0702).
